name: concrete block production | concrete block | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/29141/documentation

This dataset describes the production of mixed blocks of concrete in the warm climate zone of Santa Isabel, Ecuador. The blocks have a characteristic compressive strength of 3.1 - 3.45 MPa and are mainly used in non-structural masonry walls. The produced blocks weigh approximately 5.4 kg and the most common dimensions are of (10 x 40 x 20) cm (width, length, height). Data comes from measurement and information provided in the factory visited in March 2022 ("HormiOrtiz"). The dataset includes the whole manufacturing process of the blocks. It does not include administration and infrastructure. ;This dataset was developed by Estefania Barros, Kristi Padrón, Jonnathan Aguirre and Juan Sebastian Martines, under the supervision of Prof. Dolores Sucozhañay and Prof. Paul Vanegas, from the Inclusive Circular Economy and Sustainable Development Research Group of the University of Cuenca (ECI) in the frame of the CEELA (Strengthening capacities for energy efficiency in buildings in Latin America) project with the support of the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC).

The activity starts with the reception of raw materials at the concrete block production site.

This activity ends with the production of concrete block. The dataset includes the reception of materials, dosing and mixing, block production by vibration, curing and storage, as well as internal transports. The dataset does not include the packaging. Only discarded blocks and waste wood are taken into account as solid waste.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2395:Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement and plaster

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is from 2022 (year of data collection) to 2023 (year of dataset compilation).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset represents the production of concrete blocks representative for Ecuador. Data comes from primary data collection in Ecuador.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current production technology. The dataset covers the main technologies for concrete block production in Ecuador. The manufacturing process begins by dosing and mixing the cement, aggregates and water. In the block machine, the steel cast is filled with the mix and the block is shaped and compacted by vibration. The fresh block is then transported to a place where the drying/curing process begins. The cure is done by spraying water over the blocks in order to ensure proper hydration of the cement and avoid that the blocks get "burned". The spraying is done for three days, three times per day. The blocks are then packed in pallets and stored.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data obtained by a process assessment in a technical visit in a concrete block factory. It is assumed that this dataset represents 60% of the concrete block production activity in Ecuador, since the process is semi mechanized and it could change between factories in Ecuador. Land occupation exchange is used as an estimate of infrastructure. Machinery use is accounted for through their fuel / electricity consumption.

exchanges.description: The dataset represents 1 kg of a hollow mixed block, with dimensions (10 x 40 x 20) cm (width x length x height) and average mass of 5,44 kg.

exchanges.description: This value is considered standard for the mixed block production process. It was extrapolated from the dataset "concrete block production BR" due to its similarity with the process in Ecuador. The pallets are used for packing and storing the blocks.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. This value corresponds to water that evaporates during the drying processes. Calculated as the difference in the property "water in wet mass" (WWM) of inputs (rainwater, gravel, sand and cement) and outputs (concrete block and waste concrete) of the activity.
Water content used for the production process as informed by the owner of the factory. Water used for the production of mixed blocks is water obtained from the rain.

exchanges.description: Calculate value. Proxy for one component of PENETRON ADMIX®, which is a grey powder with pH equal to 10-13, mostly consisting of Portland cement and various active, proprietary chemicals. The original amount of ADMIX for the production process of 1 kg concrete block is 0.000001286 m3, as informed by the owner of the factory. The value is calculated considering the density of the admix (1.131 kg/m3) and the share in % of the inorganic chemicals (see parameters for details)

exchanges.description: 25kg of cement is used per concrete batch, each batch produces 272 kg cement blocks (71 blocks of 5.44 kg each on average). Cement content used for the production process as informed by the owner of the factory.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. This value represents the amount of sand and volcanic ash used for the production of 1 kg of mixed block, according to the information provided by the owner of the factory. The amounts of sand and volcanic ash were provided as number of wheelbarrows used. In this sense, volume and density were used to determine their mass.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Sum of electricity consumption (motor power (kW/kg)*run time(h)). The energy used is the motors' power times the total time they function.

exchanges.description: Estimated for infrastructure. Land occupation calculated as the land occupied by the production facility (0.25 ha) divided by the annual production volume of the facility (4'665'600 kg concrete block/year).

This value is considered standard for the mixed block production process. It was extrapolated from the dataset "concrete block production BR" due to its similarity with the process in Ecuador. Waste wood refers to discard of used wooden pallets used for packing the blocks.
